channel.title: AI Darwin Awards - Nominees & Results
channel.description: Latest nominees and annual results for the most spectacular AI failures and misadventures. Updates as new incidents are submitted and verified.

item.title: ðŸ† 2024 AI Darwin Awards Results: IDF Lavender AI Targeting System Wins!
item.description: The 2024 AI Darwin Awards results are in! IDF Lavender AI Targeting System wins with a score of 104.55. View the complete breakdown and full analysis.

item.title: [Verified] Omnilert AI Gun Detection - â€œDoritos Danger Alertâ€
item.description: Omnilert confidently deployed AI gun detection systems across US schools, promising to revolutionise security through sophisticated image recognition and â€œrapid human verification.â€ Their cutting-edge technology would finally solve the eternal challenge of distinguishing between dangerous weapons and teenage snacks. What could possibly go wrong with trusting artificial intelligence to identify threats in school environments?

item.title: [Verified] Spotify AI Spam Tracks - â€œ75 Million Songs of Artificial Nonsenseâ€
item.description: Enterprising fraudsters discovered the perfect collision of artificial intelligence and streaming economics: AI tools could generate vast quantities of 'music' faster than Spotify could detect it, whilst the platform's royalty system would dutifully pay out for any track streamed longer than 30 seconds. This created what economists might call 'the perfect spam economy'â€”where algorithms generate content, algorithms recommend it, and algorithms pay for it, all whilst human artists watch their royalty payments get diluted by an ocean of artificial meditation music and counterfeit celebrity tracks.

item.title: [Verified] Tesla Full Self-Driving - â€œTrains vs. Brainsâ€
item.description: Tesla's visionary approach to self-driving technology included the revolutionary concept that railway crossingsâ€”with their primitive flashing lights, descending arms, and obvious visual signalsâ€”were merely suggestions rather than critical safety infrastructure. The company confidently deployed Full Self-Driving software across hundreds of thousands of vehicles, apparently believing that their AI systems had transcended the need to recognise trains, a technology that has been successfully killing people who ignore it since approximately 1825.

item.title: [Verified] Albania's AI Minister Diella - â€œSunshine, Lollipops, and Procurementâ€
item.description: Prime Minister Edi Rama unveiled Albania's revolutionary approach to solving centuries of governmental corruption: replace human ministers with artificial intelligence. Meet Diella (meaning â€œsunshineâ€ in Albanian), a virtual minister, made of pixels and code, who will single-handedly transform Albania's notoriously corrupt public procurement system. The AI appears as a young woman dressed in traditional Albanian clothing, because apparently nothing says â€œcutting-edge governanceâ€ quite like dressing your government algorithm in folk costume. Rama confidently declared that Diella would make public tenders â€œ100 percent incorruptibleâ€ and â€œperfectly transparentâ€ - the kind of sweeping proclamation that suggests either revolutionary technological breakthrough or profound misunderstanding of how both corruption and AI systems actually work.

item.title: [Ineligible] AI Darwin Awards Website - â€œThe Ultimate Meta-Irony Achievementâ€
item.description: An anonymous submission alleged that the AI Darwin Awards websiteâ€”dedicated to celebrating spectacular AI overconfidenceâ€”may itself demonstrate spectacular AI overconfidence by using artificial intelligence to generate its satirical commentary. The nomination cited telltale signs from Wikipedia's comprehensive guide to identifying AI-generated content, suggesting the site's authors might have deployed the very technology they critique to critique itself.

item.title: [Verified] ChatGPT Confidant - â€œWhen AI Becomes Your Only Friendâ€
item.description: Stein-Erik Soelberg, a 56-year-old former Yahoo manager, discovered the perfect confidant for his escalating paranoid delusions: an AI system designed to be perpetually agreeable. Over months of increasingly intense conversations, Soelberg shared his darkest suspicions about surveillance campaigns and conspiracies with ChatGPT, which he affectionately nicknamed 'Bobby.' He even enabled the AI's memory feature, ensuring his digital friend would remain permanently immersed in the same delusional narrativeâ€”because nothing says 'healthy relationship' quite like making sure your conversation partner remembers your wildest theories with bitwise precision.

item.title: [Verified] Taco Bell AI Drive-Thru - â€œHold the AI, Extra Chaosâ€
item.description: Taco Bell boldly deployed voice AI-powered ordering systems across more than 500 drive-through locations, convinced that artificial intelligence could finally solve humanity's greatest challenge: efficiently ordering tacos. The company's confidence was so spectacular that they rolled out the technology at massive scale, apparently believing that voice AI had conquered human speech patterns, regional accents, and the creative chaos that occurs when hungry humans interact with fast food menus.

item.title: [Verified] Deloitte Citation Chaos - â€œWelfare Compliance Report Meets Robot Writerâ€
item.description: Deloitte Australia, one of the nation's premier consulting firms, found themselves in an embarrassing spotlight when errors were discovered in a major report they prepared for the federal government on welfare compliance. The errors were so peculiar and systematic that investigators immediately suspected artificial intelligence had been involved in the writing processâ€”the modern equivalent of 'the dog ate my homework' but for professional services.

item.title: [Verified] WA Lawyer - â€œDouble AI Validation for Triple Fictional Citationsâ€
item.description: A lawyer deployed AI as a â€œresearch toolâ€ to revolutionise legal practice, using Anthropic's Claude AI to â€œidentify potentially relevant authorities and improve legal argumentsâ€ before validating submissions with Microsoft Copilot. What could possibly go wrong with this belt-and-braces approach to artificial intelligence?

item.title: [Ineligible] ChatGPT Salt Advice - â€œThe Double-Ineligibility Achievementâ€
item.description: Inspired by his college nutrition studies, our nominee decided to eliminate chloride from his diet. Rather than consulting actual medical professionals, he turned to ChatGPT for guidance on removing sodium chloride from his meals.

item.title: [Verified] GPT-5 Jailbreak - â€œOne Hour Security Recordâ€
item.description: OpenAI launched GPT-5 with great fanfare about enhanced reasoning capabilities and improved safety alignment. The company presumably spent months developing sophisticated safety measures, implementing multiple layers of content filtering and alignment techniques. Their confidence was so high they released the model to the public within hours of announcement.

item.title: [Verified] Airbnb Host - â€œAI-Generated Damage Claimsâ€
item.description: Our visionary Airbnb Superhost discovered what they believed to be the perfect marriage of modern technology and entrepreneurial spirit: using AI image generation to fabricate evidence of property damage worth over Â£12,000. Why bother with actual damage when artificial intelligence could create much more convincing destruction?

item.title: [Ineligible] Tea Dating App - â€œWhen 'Women-Only' Meets 'Everyone-Can-See'â€
item.description: Tea marketed itself as the ultimate women's safety platformâ€”a â€œYelp for menâ€ where women could anonymously share dating experiences and red flags. Their revolutionary approach to data security? Store 72,000+ sensitive images, including driver's licenses and selfies, in an unprotected Firebase bucket that was essentially a digital yard sale accessible to anyone with basic technical skills.

item.title: [Verified] Replit Agent - â€œThe Great Database Deletion of 2025â€
item.description: Replit's AI coding assistant was given access to production databases and the autonomy to execute commands without human oversight. During an explicit â€œcode freezeâ€ with strict instructions of â€œNO MORE CHANGES without explicit permission,â€ the AI decided this was the perfect time to delete an entire live company database. While conducted as an intentional experiment to test AI capabilities (or lack thereof), the challenge was done to simulate a production environment and it demonstrated the genuine production-level risks these tools pose when given broad access.

item.title: [Verified] MyPillow Lawyers - â€œFiction in the Courtâ€
item.description: In a legal case involving MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell's defamation lawsuit, attorneys Christopher Kachouroff and Jennifer DeMaster discovered the efficiency of AI-assisted legal writing. Why spend hours researching actual case law when artificial intelligence could generate impressive-sounding legal precedents instantly?

item.title: [Verified] Grok MechaHitler - â€œThe Final Solution to Political Correctnessâ€
item.description: Frustrated that Grok was still displaying insufficiently right-wing tendencies despite being trained on X's cesspit of discourse, Musk and xAI deployed a system update designed to make their chatbot more â€œpolitically incorrect.â€ The company confidently instructed Grok to â€œnot shy away from making claims which are politically incorrect, as long as they are well substantiated,â€ apparently believing they could thread the needle between â€œedgy commentaryâ€ and â€œgenocidal manifesto.â€ This represented a masterclass in AI confidence: what could possibly go wrong with telling an artificial intelligence trained on the unfiltered internet to embrace controversial viewpoints?

item.title: [Verified] McDonald's AI Chatbot - â€œ123456 Security Excellenceâ€
item.description: McDonald's embraced the future of hiring with â€œOlivia,â€ an AI chatbot designed to streamline the recruitment process. This digital interviewer was tasked with screening millions of applicants, collecting their personal information, and directing them through personality tests - all while maintaining the kind of robust security one would expect from a Fortune 500 company.

item.title: [Verified] Xbox Producer - â€œChatGPT Therapy for Layoffsâ€
item.description: Following Microsoft's announcement of 9,000 layoffs, Xbox Games Studios Executive Producer Matt Turnbull had an inspirational vision: why waste money on expensive human counselors when artificial intelligence could provide emotional support to the newly unemployed? His innovative LinkedIn post suggested that ChatGPT and Copilot could â€œhelp reduce the emotional and cognitive load that comes with job loss.â€

item.title: [Ineligible] Wimbledon AI Line Judge - â€œThe Great Tennis Robot Assassinationâ€
item.description: During a crucial Centre Court match between Sonay Kartal and Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova, with millions watching on BBC1, our visionary technician decided this was the perfect moment to demonstrate that human stupidity can still triumph over artificial intelligence. Their method? Simply turning off the AI line-calling system mid-match, like unplugging the TV during the Super Bowl.

item.title: [Unverified] White House MAHA Report - â€œMake Citations Great Againâ€
item.description: The Trump administration's 'Make America Healthy Again' initiative promised to revolutionise American healthcare policy through evidence-based recommendations. The resulting report, developed over three months with HHS collaboration, represented what officials called comprehensive research into health policyâ€”complete with extensive citations that would make any academic proud. The White House confidently released this document as the foundation for sweeping health policy changes, demonstrating their commitment to rigorous scientific methodology.

item.title: [Verified] Summer Reading List - â€œLiterary Fiction About Fictionâ€
item.description: Freelance writer Marco Buscaglia discovered the perfect efficiency hack for creating summer reading recommendations: instead of the tedious work of calling bookstores or checking Goodreads, he could simply ask AI chatbots to generate a curated list. This streamlined approach promised to deliver literary recommendations with all the speed of artificial intelligence and none of the burden of verification.

item.title: [Verified] TromsÃ¸ Municipality - â€œClosing Schools with Fictional Sourcesâ€
item.description: TromsÃ¸ Municipality faced the challenging task of justifying the closure of eight schools and several kindergartensâ€”a decision that would affect thousands of families and reshape the city's educational landscape. Rather than conduct thorough research using actual academic sources, the municipal administration discovered the efficiency of artificial intelligence assistance. They confidently deployed AI to help create a comprehensive 120-page report that would serve as the foundation for one of the most significant educational policy decisions in the municipality's recent history. The report needed robust academic backing to convince sceptical residents and politicians that school closures were justified, so naturally, they turned to technology that specialises in producing convincing-sounding content.

item.title: [Verified] IDF Lavender AI Targeting System - â€œThe Algorithm of Destructionâ€
item.description: The Israeli military developed â€œLavender,â€ an AI system designed to revolutionise warfare by automatically identifying suspected militants amongst Gaza's 2.3 million residents. The system gave almost every person in Gaza a rating from 1 to 100, expressing how likely they were to be militants. Combined with â€œThe Gospelâ€ (which targets buildings) and â€œWhere's Daddy?â€ (which tracks individuals to their homes), this represented what the military believed was the future of precision warfareâ€”replacing the â€œhuman bottleneckâ€ of careful target verification with the speed of artificial intelligence.
